timeline.bodyText: If it is only filter pushdown, getPhysicalPlanOptimizers is the better place to put the optimizer.

timeline.bodyText: This patch has many pinot-related concept. Is broker something for druid as well?
timeline.author: highker

replies.bodyText: oh, yes, Druid has broker, too: https://druid.apache.org/docs/latest/design/broker.html
replies.author: zhenxiao

timeline.message: Get rid of presto util dependency in Druid connector

timeline.bodyText: I wonder why this code looks so familiar :-)
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh

replies.bodyText: haha, yes, I copied a bunch of code from ur Pinot connector :)
replies.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText:
Hi @zhenxiao , It would help the reader if you could refer to the PR or commit of the Pinot connector optimizer PR/commit in your commit message. This code is basically identical to the Pinot connector and it would not only help with proper attribution but also if we subsequently need to fix some bugs in both the pinot/druid connectors.
Also, it would be great if you could think a bit about how we may refactor to share more common code b/w the pinot and the druid connector. What did you think about what we could refactor into a separate module ?
Thanks
replies.author: agrawaldevesh

replies.bodyText: Good idea. Yep, Pinot and Druid are similar. We could think about refactoring common code. I will add "Reference Pinot Connector" in the commit message. The optimizer code is similar. The code are not identical, Druid has its own segment scan log and broker page source. Logic for FilterExpressionConverter are different, too.
replies.author: zhenxiao
